issue.title: Setting the rate of real-time simulator

content.raw:
do you mean the Physics --> update rate setting? The real-time factor is a product of update rate and step size ... so as long as gazebo is able to compute fast enough the real-time factor can be lowered or increased by changing the update rate. With a step-size of 0.001 you need an update rate of 1000 to get 1.0 real-time factor, so setting the update rate to 800 would give you 0.8

To make the real-time factor unbounded you set update rate to 0.

do you mean the Physics --> update rate setting? The real-time factor is a product of update rate and step size ... so as long as gazebo is able to compute fast enough the real-time factor can be lowered or increased by changing the update rate. With a step-size of 0.001 you need an update rate of 1000 to get 1.0 real-time factor, so setting the update rate to 800 would give you 0.8

To make the real-time factor unbounded you set update rate to 0.
